Hi ,
 You can use a cmd file to launch ur application.
place the cmd file where your class files are present
Than populate the cmd file with the followings: Change where u need

REM start

SET JAVA_HOME=C:\jdk1.4.2_02     
SET PATH=%JAVA_HOME%/bin
SET CLASSPATH=
SET CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;<PATH OF JUNIT>/junit.jar
SET CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;<path of your WPFStatDescriptor>/WPFStatDescriptor.class
SET CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;<path of other jar or class>/file name
SET CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;.

java <class file to be run> <arguement>

pause

REM end

launch ur program using the above cmd file. Name the above file RUN.CMD

SUBHENDU PAUL

Software Developer I

CONNECTiVA Systems India (P) Ltd



 Mobile:  98305 44937

 Office:   (033) 23577531 Ext: 40 


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Jian Tang 
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, June 15, 2004 9:57 PM
  Subject: [junit] java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:


  I am using Junit 3.8.1 in windows 2000. My junit test case uses one 
  class called WPFStatDescriptor. Everything compiles fine. However, 
  when I execute the junit test case, it keeps displaying 
  java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: WPFStatDescriptor.

  I have include the jar file which has WPFStatDescriptor in the 
  CLASSPATH. I am wondering maybe Junit uses a different JVM? Anyone 
  can help me?
